trans-unit.source: Provides methods used to render a combo box control with visual styles.
This class cannot be inherited.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBoxRenderer> class provides a set of `static` methods that can be used to render a combo box control with the current visual style of the operating system.
Rendering a control refers to drawing the user interface of a control.
This is useful if you are drawing a custom control that should have the appearance of the current visual style.

To draw a combo box, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBoxRenderer.DrawTextBox%2A> method to draw the text box and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBoxRenderer.DrawDropDownButton%2A> method to draw the drop-down arrow.

If visual styles are enabled in the operating system and visual styles are applied to the client area of application windows, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBoxRenderer.DrawTextBox%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBoxRenderer.DrawDropDownButton%2A> will draw the combo box with the current visual style.
Otherwise, these methods will throw an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException>.
To determine whether the members of this class can be used, you can check the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBoxRenderer.IsSupported%2A> property.

This class wraps the functionality of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer?displayProperty=fullName> that is set to one of the elements exposed by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.ComboBox.DropDownButton?displayProperty=fullName> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.TextBox.TextEdit?displayProperty=fullName> classes.
For more information, see [Rendering Controls with Visual Styles](~/docs/framework/winforms/controls/rendering-controls-with-visual-styles.md).
Draws a drop-down arrow with the current visual style of the operating system.
Before calling this method, you should verify that the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBoxRenderer.IsSupported%2A> property returns `true`.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> used to draw the drop-down arrow.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that specifies the bounds of the drop-down arrow.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.ComboBoxState"></xref> values that specifies the visual state of the drop-down arrow.
The operating system does not support visual styles.
-or-
Visual styles are disabled by the user in the operating system.
-or-
Visual styles are not applied to the client area of application windows.
Draws a text box in the specified state and bounds.
Before calling this method, you should verify that the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBoxRenderer.IsSupported%2A> property returns `true`.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> used to draw the text box.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that specifies the bounds of the text box.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.ComboBoxState"></xref> values that specifies the visual state of the text box.
The operating system does not support visual styles.
-or-
Visual styles are disabled by the user in the operating system.
-or-
Visual styles are not applied to the client area of application windows.
Draws a text box in the specified state and bounds, with the specified text.
Before calling this method, you should verify that the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBoxRenderer.IsSupported%2A> property returns `true`.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> used to draw the text box.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that specifies the bounds of the text box.
The <xref href="System.String"></xref> to draw in the text box.
The to apply to comboBoxText.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.ComboBoxState"></xref> values that specifies the visual state of the text box.
The operating system does not support visual styles.
-or-
Visual styles are disabled by the user in the operating system.
-or-
Visual styles are not applied to the client area of application windows.
Draws a text box in the specified state and bounds, with the specified text and text bounds.
Before calling this method, you should verify that the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBoxRenderer.IsSupported%2A> property returns `true`.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> used to draw the text box.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that specifies the bounds of the text box.
The <xref href="System.String"></xref> to draw in the text box.
The to apply to comboBoxText.
The that specifies the bounds in which to draw comboBoxText.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.ComboBoxState"></xref> values that specifies the visual state of the text box.
The operating system does not support visual styles.
-or-
Visual styles are disabled by the user in the operating system.
-or-
Visual styles are not applied to the client area of application windows.
Draws a text box in the specified state and bounds, with the specified text and text formatting.
Before calling this method, you should verify that the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBoxRenderer.IsSupported%2A> property returns `true`.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> used to draw the text box.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that specifies the bounds of the text box.
The <xref href="System.String"></xref> to draw in the text box.
The to apply to comboBoxText.
A bitwise combination of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TextFormatFlags"></xref> values.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.ComboBoxState"></xref> values that specifies the visual state of the text box.
The operating system does not support visual styles.
-or-
Visual styles are disabled by the user in the operating system.
-or-
Visual styles are not applied to the client area of application windows.
Draws a text box in the specified state and bounds, with the specified text, text formatting, and text bounds.
Before calling this method, you should verify that the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBoxRenderer.IsSupported%2A> property returns `true`.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> used to draw the text box.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that specifies the bounds of the text box.
The <xref href="System.String"></xref> to draw in the text box.
The to apply to comboBoxText.
The that specifies the bounds in which to draw comboBoxText.
A bitwise combination of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TextFormatFlags"></xref> values.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.ComboBoxState"></xref> values that specifies the visual state of the text box.
The operating system does not support visual styles.
-or-
Visual styles are disabled by the user in the operating system.
-or-
Visual styles are not applied to the client area of application windows.
Gets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ComboBoxRenderer"></xref> class can be used to draw a combo box with visual styles.

If this property is `false`, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBoxRenderer.DrawTextBox%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBoxRenderer.DrawDropDownButton%2A> methods will throw an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException>.
`true` if the user has enabled visual styles in the operating system and visual styles are applied to the client area of application windows; otherwise, `false`.
